--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Stacy <EmprzAnastazia@a...>" 
<EmprzAnastazia@a...> wrote:
> 
> > Blackfang: I'm afraid I can't leave you two together... At least 
not
> > you. (He was staring hard at Maxima) You must understand that in 
no
> > way you can be left alone, and seeing that you are former 
comrades, 
> I
> > simply can't do that.
> > 
> > Although he doesn't like it, he stays near the two decepticons.
> 
> She glared at the intruding if not unwelcome transformer. Then 
turned 
> back to Empath.
> 
> > 
> > As the two discussed, a bit too far for Blackfang to hear, Ragnar 
> came
> > up a small hill and overheard the conversation. He decided not to 
do
> > anything about and kept the info for himself.
> > 
> > Instead, he went back a few meters downhill and stomped on a 
nearby
> > log, utterly shattering it. They would hear him.
> 
> She heard him alright. This annoyed her a lot. Sneering at the 
> interloper. She had a feeling that her quest to restore herself 
would 
> not be easy by any means.

Having sensed Ragnar's presence long before she heard him, Empath 
decided the best place to hide was right out in the open.  She knew 
the Ghost Bear had overheard.  "I don't see what you're complaining 
about, Maxima." she says.  "They scrapped your old, highly 
inefficient body in favor of a top-of-the-line model.  I'm quite 
happy the way I am now.  But, if you really want to find Teletran-1, 
be wary.  The Tripredacus forces would gain even more of an advantage 
then they have already if the Ark were destroyed, and they know 
this.  You must be careful not to lead them to it by accident."
